update.description:
Adding the ability to publish a message using the `ign` command line tool.

Example usage that publishes a string message on the `/foo` topic with data="Hello"

```
ign topic -t /foo -m ign_msgs.StringMsg -p 'data: "Hello"'
```

Run the `examples/subscriber` with the above command to test.

Other changes:

1. Changed `IGNITION_VISIBLE` to `IGNITION_TRANSPORT_VISIBLE` to avoid naming conflicts with other ignition libraries.
1. Removed all internal protobuf messages, and instead transport now depends on ignition-msgs.
update.title: Pub_cmd

content.raw:
This is failing on homebrew because `ignition-msgs` isn't a dependency of `ignition-transport1`.

If we bump the major version on the default branch to 2 in this pull request, then I can add a new `ignition-transport2` formula that depends on `ignition-msgs`
content.html:
This is failing on homebrew because ignition-msgs isn't a dependency of ignition-transport1.

If we bump the major version on the default branch to 2 in this pull request, then I can add a new ignition-transport2 formula that depends on ignition-msgs

content.raw:
The problem is that inside `cmdTopicPub()`, we advertise the topic and right after we publish. We don't let the other nodes time to subscribe before the publish is executed. I think what we need here is a `WaitForSubscribers(<topic>)` function between `Advertise()` and `Publish()`. It looks better to me to introduce this delay inside `cmdTopicPub()` than inside `PublishHelper()`.

We don't have this function ready yet (it's leaving in a branch), so we could add a `sleep_for()` with a note that this should replaced when `WaitForSubscribers()` is ready. What do you think?
content.html:
The problem is that inside cmdTopicPub(), we advertise the topic and right after we publish. We don't let the other nodes time to subscribe before the publish is executed. I think what we need here is a WaitForSubscribers(<topic>) function between Advertise() and Publish(). It looks better to me to introduce this delay inside cmdTopicPub() than inside PublishHelper().

We don't have this function ready yet (it's leaving in a branch), so we could add a sleep_for() with a note that this should replaced when WaitForSubscribers() is ready. What do you think?

content.raw: With out this, the pub command from the command line will fail. Is there another way?
content.html: With out this, the pub command from the command line will fail. Is there another way?

content.raw: Still not 100% convinced about this. The `initialized` in the discovery guarantees that you have information about the rest of the nodes, which is interesting if you want to receive data. Not sure why we want to wait here if we are sending data. This line adds a delay of ~2 seconds if we send a message on startup, for example, when running `example/publisher`.
content.html: Still not 100% convinced about this. The initialized in the discovery guarantees that you have information about the rest of the nodes, which is interesting if you want to receive data. Not sure why we want to wait here if we are sending data. This line adds a delay of ~2 seconds if we send a message on startup, for example, when running example/publisher.

content.raw: Thanks. I'm trying to figure out the windows + jenkins issues now.
content.html: Thanks. I'm trying to figure out the windows + jenkins issues now.

content.raw: I see that Jenkins is happy with the [Trusty version](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64/109/). The [Windows version ](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/202) has some problems, although I managed to compile it and run the tests on my local Windows. The [Homebrew version](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/100/console) is complaining about ign-msgs, I believe we have to update the Ignition-transport formula (new version 2.x.x?).
content.html: I see that Jenkins is happy with the Trusty version. The Windows version has some problems, although I managed to compile it and run the tests on my local Windows. The Homebrew version is complaining about ign-msgs, I believe we have to update the Ignition-transport formula (new version 2.x.x?).

content.html: Ticketed issue #39

content.raw: That is known behavior.
content.html: That is known behavior.

content.raw:
Not sure if the problem was introduced by this PR, but `ign topic -i` is showing publishers, but not subscribers:

1. Compile examples

1. Start publisher, it publishes HELLO messages

1. Start subscriber, it receives HELLO messages

1. Check topic info with `ign topic -i -t /foo` and we see the publisher, but not the subscriber.
content.html:
Not sure if the problem was introduced by this PR, but ign topic -i is showing publishers, but not subscribers:

  1. Compile examples

  2. Start publisher, it publishes HELLO messages

  3. Start subscriber, it receives HELLO messages

  4. Check topic info with ign topic -i -t /foo and we see the publisher, but not the subscriber.

content.html: I haven't tried. I was asking because grepping for math I didn't find ignition math being directly used by transport. Is this something we need to fix in ign-msgs?
